metadata.synopsis: After WithersChronicles, if the player made the deal with Raphael (the Orphic Hammer in exchange for the Crown of Karsus), Raphael shows up to report back on how that went.

44.speaker: Raphael
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

53.speaker: Raphael
53.text: A thief, a liar, and a fool.

33.speaker: Raphael
33.text: We had an agreement, and you broke it. The Crown was supposed to be mine.

52.speaker: Raphael
52.text: Instead of delivering it to its true home in the Hells, you gifted it to Mystra.

35.speaker: Raphael
35.text: Instead of delivering it to its true home in the Hells, you allowed Gale Dekarios to deliver it to Mystra.

72.speaker: Raphael
72.text: I should snuff you out and make coin of your soul, but it will be more amusing to let you see the consequences of your actions.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: Do you really think that the Crown is safer in the hands of a goddess than in the claws of a devil?

41.speaker: Raphael
41.text: Look to the history of these Realms. It is not the devils but the gods who sunder, wreck and ruin - it is the gods who instigate each new crisis.

30.speaker: Raphael
30.text: It is the gods who almost brought doom to your world. I was merely a witness to their conspiracy.

14.speaker: Raphael
14.text: And I would have dealt fairly with you. I cannot say what Mystra will do.

58.speaker: Raphael
58.text: Perhaps the crown is a mere trinket to one of her power, or perhaps it is the key to unlocking some dreadful new potential in her portfolio.

64.speaker: Raphael
64.text: Time will tell, as it always does. Look to the heavens and pray for peace - but  prepare for a cataclysm.

55.speaker: Raphael
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

26.speaker: Raphael
26.text: A thief, a liar, and a danger to anyone foolish enough to trust you.

42.speaker: Raphael
42.text: Spurred on by your victory over the Netherbrain, you took it upon yourself to challenge Mystra for control of her domain.

57.speaker: Raphael
57.text: Your mad hubris tainted your otherwise brilliant mind.

24.speaker: Raphael
24.text: Obliterated by Mystra, you are but a fragment of what you were - all-but erased from existence as if you were an error in Mystra's ledger.

18.speaker: Raphael
18.text: Your life does not matter to me, but it wasn't the only thing lost. When you challenged Mystra, she took the Crown from you.

70.speaker: Raphael
70.text: Now it is out of my grasp once more. Either destroyed, or claimed by the goddess and hidden away where I cannot sense its presence.

1.speaker: Raphael
1.text: There is one consolation - what remains of your soul is mine now, a new resident in my House of Hope.

36.speaker: Raphael
36.text: We're going to have such fun together.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

71.speaker: Raphael
71.text: Gale Dekarios trusted you. And do you know what became of him?

31.speaker: Raphael
31.text: Spurred on by your victory over the Netherbrain, he took it upon himself to challenge Mystra for control of her domain.

0.speaker: Raphael
0.text: A good ally - a good friend - would have weaned him off the mad hubris that tainted his otherwise brilliant mind.

6.speaker: Raphael
6.text: A good person would have put a stop to his ambitions.

29.speaker: Raphael
29.text: You, by word and by deed, encouraged him to indulge his worst impulses, and now he is gone.

2.speaker: Raphael
2.text: Mystra obliterated him - erased him from existence as if he were an error in her ledger.

65.speaker: Raphael
65.text: His life does not matter to me, but Gale wasn't the only thing lost. When he challenged Mystra, he took the Crown with him.

48.speaker: Raphael
48.text: He thought it would give him an advantage, that it would protect him from the fury of a god. He was wrong.

61.speaker: Raphael
61.text: When Mystra eliminated Gale, the Crown was lost too. Either destroyed, or claimed by the goddess and hidden away where I cannot sense its presence.

20.speaker: Raphael
20.text: There is one consolation - Gale's soul is mine now, a new resident in my House of Hope. Perhaps you'll come to visit one day.

67.speaker: Raphael
67.text: My door is always open to old friends.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

56.speaker: Raphael
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

9.speaker: Raphael
9.text: The Crown really is marvelous - I'm almost tempted to dig Karsus' soul out of whatever pit he's in so I can show him what his creation is capable of now it's in the right hands.

34.speaker: Raphael
34.text: My legions are beginning their assault on Zariel's Flying Fortress just about now - it will fall before the sun rises over Toril, and Avernus will be mine.

45.speaker: Raphael
45.text: Conquering the other Hells will be simplicity itself - some of the Archdevils are already making overtures of peace and promises of tribute.

8.speaker: Raphael
8.text: My dear father Mephistopheles is among them.

17.speaker: Raphael
17.text: Even he sees how the tide has turned. And with all Nine Hells under my command, I will end The Blood War - inferna victoria - and look for new worlds to conquer.

49.speaker: Raphael
49.text: It won't be long before I come knocking at your door.

43.speaker: Raphael
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

60.speaker: Raphael
60.text: I owe you a debt of gratitude.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Raphael in a void, addressing the camera as if speaking directly to the player.

38.speaker: Raphael
38.text: The tadpole would have feasted on that impressive mind of yours if you hadn't fought so hard.

63.speaker: Raphael
63.text: But mere survival was not enough for you.

13.speaker: Raphael
13.text: It is thanks to you that Gale, the Wizard of Waterdeep, became Dekarios the Divine, god of ambition.

66.speaker: Raphael
66.text: Without you, he would not have survived the appetites of the tadpole.

37.speaker: Raphael
37.text: It would have feasted on that impressive mind of his, and all of his talent would have been snuffed out forever.

19.speaker: Raphael
19.text: But mere survival was not enough. Not for Gale, and not for you.

10.speaker: Raphael
10.text: Saving your world from the gods and monsters that threatened it wasn't enough.

69.speaker: Raphael
69.text: You wanted more, and the mad hubris that has always tainted you came to the fore. Now that the Crown is yours, you will make Celestia quake.

59.speaker: Raphael
59.text: Gale wanted more, and you encouraged him to ignore every sensible instinct, to ignore the lesson of Karsus' Folly, and to reach for the heavens.

40.speaker: Raphael
40.text: You were the spark that rekindled Gale's hubris, and set him on a course that will make Celestia quake.

22.speaker: Raphael
22.text: I longed for the Crown, to satisfy my own ambitions, and I was furious that it had escaped me again.

4.speaker: Raphael
4.text: But I have assessed the situation, pondered every variable, plotted every possible course... and I have come to realise that this is for the best.

23.speaker: Raphael
23.text: In time, long after your friends and family are gone, you will cause such division and chaos in these Realms that even the lords of the Hells will be aghast to see it.

3.speaker: Raphael
3.text: In time, long after you're gone, Gale Dekarios will cause such division and chaos in these Realms that even the lords of the Hells will be aghast to see it.

47.speaker: Raphael
47.text: Ambition. Such a delicious sin for mortalkind to indulge in - such a dreadful weapon for an immortal to wield.

11.speaker: Raphael
11.text: The gods will be sundered. And from their ruin, I will rise.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

21.speaker: Raphael
21.text: You defied me, Wizard of Waterdeep, and you paid the price.

16.speaker: Raphael
16.text: I will admit, I was angry when you failed to deliver the Crown to me. Those who break a deal with this devil do not usually live to tell the tale.

25.speaker: Raphael
25.text: All is forgiven though. The Crown came to me, as promised, and the method of delivery was spectacular.

32.speaker: Raphael
32.text: You harnessed its power, as Karsus once did, and you too fell into ruin. You were halfway to heaven when the orb detonated, tearing you apart.

51.speaker: Raphael
51.text: All that remained were ashes, blood, tears... and the Crown. Always the Crown.

7.speaker: Raphael
7.text: Your decimation did not even leave a mark on it. And now, only a fragment of your soul remains... and it is mine.

62.speaker: Raphael
62.text: Ambition. Courage. Hope. They all burn you in the end.

50.speaker: Raphael
50.text: I will bend the Crown to my will now, and use its power to bring the Nine Hells under my command

39.speaker: Raphael
39.text: When that is done, I will need new worlds to conquer.

27.speaker: Raphael
27.text: Perhaps your soul will be part of my legions, Gale Dekarios. If enough of it remains when I'm done toying with it.

12.speaker: Raphael
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade out on Raphael's terrible, satisfied smile.

54.speaker: Raphael
54.text: It won't be long before I come knocking at your door.

68.speaker: Raphael
68.text: The decimation of Gale did not even leave a mark on it.

46.speaker: Raphael
46.text: Gale harnessed its power, as Karsus once did, and he too fell into ruin. He was halfway to heaven when the orb detonated, tearing him apart.

15.speaker: Raphael
15.text: You were the spark of ambition that rekindled Gale's ambitions, after Mystra had so cleverly put them to rest.

28.speaker: Raphael
28.text: And you are the reason he survived the appetites of the tadpole for so long.
